solution_line_template: First find how much the rail project will increase the house value by multiplying the initial value by 25%: ${initial_value} * {rail_increase_percent} = $<<{initial_value}*{rail_increase_percent}={rail_increase_amount}>>{rail_increase_amount}
Then add that amount to the initial value to find the new value: ${rail_increase_amount} + ${initial_value} = $<<{rail_increase_amount}+{initial_value}={new_value_after_rail}>>{new_value_after_rail}

Then divide the maximum amount of property tax Jenny can afford to pay by the property tax rate to find the maximum value her house can have: ${max_affordable_tax} / {property_tax_rate} = $<<{max_affordable_tax}/{property_tax_rate}={max_house_value}>>{max_house_value}

Now subtract the house's value after the rail project from the maximum value to find how much value the improvements can have: ${max_house_value} - ${new_value_after_rail} = $<<{max_house_value}-{new_value_after_rail}={max_improvement_value}>>{max_improvement_value}
